choices.text:
In javascript output the values in a dictionary sorted by key alphabetically.
Sure, here's an example code snippet that sorts a JavaScript object (`obj`) alphabetically based on its keys and returns it as JSON-formatted string. 
```javascript
const obj = {a: 1, b: 2}; // replace with your own dictionary
let sortedObjJSON = JSON.stringify(Object.fromEntries(Object.entries(obj).sort(([k1, v1], [k2, v2]) => k1 - k2))); 
console.log("Sorted object:", sortedObjJSON); 

```
This code uses the `Object.fromEntries()` method to convert an array of key-value pairs into a new object with only its keys as properties and their values for each property, then sorts that resulting dictionary alphabetically using the builtin JavaScript sort function (`sort()`) before converting it back to JSON format stringified by calling on the `JSON.stringify()` method (which is part of NodeJS or in modern browsers).
I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions, and feel free to reach out again for further assistance with your AI assistant project :)
